parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make blind, physically or mentally. From tuphlos; to make blind, i.e. to obscure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To harden, render callous, petrify. Apparently from poros; to petrify, i.e. to indurate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From nous; to exercise the mind, i.e. to comprehend, heed.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
